t: A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.
Lord,*spn how my foes increase! There*ln are many who attack me.
Many*ln say about me, “There*ln is no help for him in God.” Selah*ig
But*pn you, Lord,*s are a shield around me, my*ln glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
I*ln cry aloud to the Lord,*s and*ln he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah*ig
I*pn lie down and sleep; I*ln wake again because the Lord*s sustains me.
I*ln will not be afraid of thousands of people who*ln have taken their stand against me on every side.
Rise*pn up, Lord!*s Save*ln me, my God! You*ln strike all my enemies on the cheek; you*ln break the teeth of the wicked.
Salvation*ln belongs to the Lord;*s may*ln your blessing be on your people. Selah*ig
